author: Special Correspondent
text:
Museum on Wheels showcasing a plethora of aspects reinforcing an appreciation of the sense of the past has elicited the desired response from the student community.

The Museum on Wheels stationed at the Vellalar Group of Institutions on Wednesday and in institutions in and around Perundurai town on Thursday, attracted several hundreds of students with apparent eagerness to assimilate the country’s historical and cultural facets.

The hundreds of exhibits including coins and stamps, besides materials related to arts, botany and zoology have been kept in 14 glass cases, Curator J. Mullai Arasu said.

Having covered Kancheepuram, Vellore, Krishnagiri and Dharmapuri in the initial phase, the museum is in Erode after completing the tour of Salem and Coimbatore districts.

On the third and fourth days, the Museum on Wheels will be stationed close to the Government Museum at the VOC Park where the public confluence is high, Mr. Mullai Arasu said.
title: Museum on Wheels captivates students
